sense.def:
To turn
ali
to turn one's head
pomeni premakniti telo ali glavo tako, da gleda v drugo smer kot prej.

seg.quote: She turned and walked away.
They kept turning round to smile at friends.
He made a smart military turn, clicking his heels.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
turns something
ali kadar nekaj
turns
, tista stvar spremeni položaj tako, da gleda v drugo smer kot prej.

seg.quote: He turned the handle and pushed open the door.
The wheels started to turn.
...with an agile turn of the wrist.

sense.def:
To turn in a particular direction
ali
to turn a corner
pomeni spremeniti smer gibanja, tako da zdaj gremo v določeno smer ali okoli vogala.

seg.quote: You come over a bridge and turn sharply to the right.
The cars were waiting to make the turn into the campus.

sense.def:
To turn to a particular page in a book
pomeni poiskati določeno stran v knjigi.

To turn one's attention or thoughts to someone or something
pomeni začeti razmišljati ali razpravljati o nekom ali nečem.

seg.quote: I wonder if we can turn our attention to something you mentioned earlier.
His thoughts turned to Calcutta.

sense.def:
To turn to someone for help or advice
pomeni prositi nekoga za pomoč ali nasvet.

cit.quote: obrniti se na koga, poiskati pomoč pri nekom

seg.quote: She'd turned to him for help.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
turns into something
, postane nekaj drugega.

seg.quote: If you apply more heat, the water turns into steam.
Soon her glee turned to fear.
My hair has turned completely grey.

sense.def:
A turn
je tudi sprememba v poteku ali izvajanju nečesa.

seg.quote: In that year things took a sharp turn for the worse.
Employers are not happy about this turn of events.

sense.def:
One's turn to do something
pomeni, da ima nekdo pravico, priložnost ali dolžnost, da nekaj naredi, potem ko so to naredili že drugi.

seg.quote: It is his turn to take the children to school.
...waiting his turn.

sense.def:
A good turn
je nekaj, kar naredimo, da bi pomagali nekomu drugemu.

Izraz
in turn
pove, da si osebe, stvari ali dejanja sledijo v zaporedju.

seg.quote: She went round the ward, talking to each woman in turn.
It became in turn a stable, a chapel, and a theatre.

sense.def:
Kadar ljudje
take turns
ali
take it in turns
, nekaj delajo drug za drugim.

seg.quote: You can take turns paying.
They took turns at the same typewriter.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
turns against someone
, mu tista oseba ni več všeč ali njenih dejanj ne odobrava več.

seg.quote: They might at any time turn against their masters.

sense.def:
To turn someone away
pomeni odkloniti nekoga ali ga poslati stran.

seg.quote: The college has been forced to turn away 300 prospective students.

sense.def:
To turn back
pomeni, da se na poti proti nekemu cilju ustavimo in se začnemo vračati proti kraju, od koder smo šli.

seg.quote: The snow started to fall, so we turned back.

sense.def:
To turn someone back
pomeni nekomu preprečiti nadaljevanje potovanja in ga prisiliti, da se vrne tja, od koder je prišel.

seg.quote: A lot of the convoys had been turned back at the border.

sense.def:
To turn down a request or offer
pomeni ne sprejeti prošnje ali ponudbe.

seg.quote: I was invited to be foreman but I turned it down.

sense.def:
To turn down something
pomeni zmanjšati jakost delovanja neke naprave, na primer glasnost radijskega sprejemnika ali toploto grelca.

seg.quote: If you are hot you can turn the heating down.

sense.def:
To turn off a road
pomeni zapeljati ali iti z ene ceste na drugo, ki vodi od prve.

seg.quote: They turned off the main road.

sense.def:
To turn off something
pomeni nastaviti stikala tako, da nekaj, na primer naprava ali stroj, neha delovati.

seg.quote: We couldn't turn the heat off.
She turned off the tap.

sense.def:
To turn on a machine or device
pomeni nastaviti stikala tako, da naprava ali stroj začne delovati.

seg.quote: Shall I turn the fire on?
She turned on the shower.

sense.def:
To turn someone on
pomeni nekoga privlačiti in spolno vznemiriti;

To turn on someone
pomeni napasti nekoga ali jezno govoriti z njim.

seg.quote: She turned on the men. ‘How can you treat your daughters like this!’

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
turns out a particular way
, se zgodi na določen način.

seg.quote: Nothing ever turned out right.
The transaction turned out badly.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
turns out to be a particular thing
, za tisto odkrijemo, da je tisto, kar je.

seg.quote: The Marvins' house turned out to be an old converted barn.

sense.def:
To turn out a light or a gas fire
pomeni nastaviti stikala tako, da svetilka ali plinski gorilnik ugasne.

Kadar podjetje ali organizacija
turns out something
, tisto stvar izdeluje.

seg.quote: Salford was turning out the type of graduate they wanted.

sense.def:
To turn someone out
pomeni prisiliti nekoga, da odide.

seg.quote: ...a woman who had been turned out of the community 20 years before.

sense.def:
To turn out something
pomeni izprazniti nekaj.

seg.quote: Come on everyone, turn out your pockets!

sense.def:
Kadar ljudje
turn out for an event or activity
, pridejo nekam, da bi sodelovali na prireditvi ali v dejavnosti ali jo opazovali.

seg.quote: Voters turned out in extraordinary numbers for the election.

sense.def:
To turn something over in one's mind
pomeni skrbno razmišljati o nečem.

seg.quote: Going home that night, Dr Renshaw turned over the facts of the case.

sense.def:
To turn something over to someone
pomeni nekaj uradno izročiti nekomu.

seg.quote: He had refused to turn over funds that belonged to Potter.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
turns up
, nekam prispe, se nekje pojavi ali je odkrito.

seg.quote: He turned up at rehearsal the next day looking awful.
You must be willing to take a job as soon as one turns up.

sense.def:
To turn up a machine or device
pomeni nastaviti stikala tako, da stroj ali naprava daje več toplote, svetlobe ali močnejši zvok.

seg.quote: Turn the volume control up.
